event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: The platform administrator should schedule a service action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: I2C access failure to a specific chip when attempting a reconfiguration operation. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
I2C access failure to a specific chip when attempting a reconfiguration operation.

This type of fault implies that the chip may be configured incorrectly
and the consequences of the fault are quite unpredictable.

The specific chip can be identified from the FMRI of the ereport associated with this fault event.


The chips affected by this fault and the consequences that might occur are as follows:


   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

     The IOC chip, FLP, and SAS Expander are all located on the Motherboard.


       IOC chip  on the Motherboard: 

         The domain may reset or  hang or some other problem may occur.


       FLP chips on the Motherboard: 

         Domain may reset or may hang or some other problem may occur.

         The IO Channel associated with the FLP is deconfigured after the platform is power cycled
         or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
.

       SAS Expander on the Motherboard: 

         Consequences are limited to accessing the HDDs, the DVDU, or external SAS devices.

         Accesses to HDDs, the DVDU, and/or external SAS devices may fail.




   SPARC Enterprise M4000/M5000 platforms:


      IOC chips on IOU's:      

         Consequences are limited to the domains (up to two domains) that are using the IOC.
         Domains may reset or may hang or some other problem may occur.
         XSB's using this IOU will not be allowed to attach the DVD or Tape after the domain
         with the XSB currently using the DVD or Tape reboots or the domain detaches the
         DVD or Tape from this XSB using a cfgdevice CLI.


            Availability of I/O devices depends on which IOC Chip was deconfigured.


            SPARC Enterprise M4000 platforms:

               All IO on the platform is deconfigured and the platform becomes unbootable.

     
            SPARC Enterprise M5000 platforms:

               IOC chip 0 provides access to PCI-X slot 0, PCI-Express slots 1-4,
               and all the internal I/O.

                  IOU#0: Internal I/O includes the DVD drive, the DAT drive, HDD#0 and HDD#1.
                  IOU#1: Internal I/O includes HDD#2 and HDD#3.



      FLP chips on IOU's:

         Consequences are limited to the domain that is using the FLP (1/2 an IOC).
         Domain may reset or may hang or some other problem may occur.
         The IO Channel associated with the FLP is deconfigured
         after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or
         after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


            Availability of I/O devices depends on which IO Channel was deconfigured.


            SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:
   
               IO Channel 0 provides access to PCI-X slot 0, PCI-Express slots 1 and 2,
               and all the internal I/O.

               IO Channel 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 3 and 4.


            SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:

               IO Channel 0 provides access to PCI-X slot 0, PCI-Express slots 1 and 2,
               and all the internal I/O.

                  IOU#0: Internal I/O includes the DVD drive, the DAT drive, HDD#0 and HDD#1.
                  IOU#1: Internal I/O includes HDD#2 and HDD#3.

               IO Channel 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 3 and 4.


      MAC chips on Memory Boards:

         Consequences are limited to the domain that is using the MAC chip.
         Domain may reset or may hang or some other problem may occur.
         Memory Board is deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
         after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
 


   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:


      IOC chips on IOU's:      

         Consequences are limited to the domains (up to two domains) that are using the IOC.
         Domains may reset or may hang or some other problem may occur.
         XSB's using this IOU will not be allowed to attach the DVD or Tape after the domain
         with the XSB currently using the DVD or Tape reboots or the domain detaches the
         DVD or Tape from this XSB using a cfgdevice CLI.

            
            Availability of I/O devices depends on which IOC Chip was deconfigured.


               SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:

   
                  IOC chip 0 provides access to PCI-Express slots 0 and 1 on this IOU.

                  IOC chip 0 provides access to PCI-Express slots 2 and 3 on this IOU.

                  IOC chip 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 4 and 5 on this IOU.

                  IOC chip 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 6 and 7 on this IOU.


      FLP chips on IOU's:

         Consequences are limited to the domain that is using the FLP (1/2 an IOC).
         Domain may reset or may hang or some other problem may occur.
         The IO Channel associated with the FLP is deconfigured
         after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or
         after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


            Availability of I/O devices depends on which IO Channel was deconfigured.


               SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:

   
                  IO Channel 0 on IOC chip 0 provides access to PCI-Express slots 0,1 on this IOU.

                  IO Channel 1 on IOC chip 0 provides access to PCI-Express slots 2,3 on this IOU.

                  IO Channel 0 on IOC chip 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 4,5 on this IOU.

                  IO Channel 1 on IOC chip 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 6,7 on this IOU.



      SAS Expander or SAS Repeater chips on an IOU, SWBP, DVDU, or TAPEU:     

         Consequences are limited to accessing the DVDU or TAPEU.
         Domain accessing the DVDU or TAPEU may see accesses fail.

         If the chip being accessed is a SAS Expander on a SWBP,
         then 'cfgdevice' CLI will not allow attach operations of the DVD and Tape to any XSB.

         If the chip being accessed is a SAS Repeater on a DVDU,
         then 'cfgdevice' CLI will not allow attach operations of the DVD and Tape to any XSB.

         If the chip being accessed is a SAS Repeater on a TAPEU,
         then 'cfgdevice' CLI will not allow attach operations of the DVD and Tape to any XSB.


      MAC chips on CMU's:

         Consequences are limited to the domains (up to two domains) that are using the MAC chip.
         Domains may reset or may hang or some other problem may occur.
         MAC chip is deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or
         after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.



The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 15:06:43 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: f72a7ccc-b849-428e-b7c8-d807f1eb39bc
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/ SCF-8002-M4 for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID:  SCF-8002-M4, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 15:06:43 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: f72a7ccc-b849-428e-b7c8-d807f1eb39bc
   DESC: I2C access failure to a specific chip when attempting a reconfiguration operation.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8002-M4 for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The resources associated with the chip will be deconfigured.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: One or more domains may be reset. It is also possible that some other problem may occur.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: The platform administrator should schedule a service action to replace
   the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be
   determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
 

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:

   xscf> fmdump -v -u f72a7ccc-b849-428e-b7c8-d807f1eb39bc

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 27 15:06:43.6874 f72a7ccc-b849-428e-b7c8-d807f1eb39bc SCF-8002-M4
  100%  fault.chassis.i2c.device-internal

        Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0
           Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/mac=0
               FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                    server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0:serial=PP0640T692:
                    part=CA06620-D001 A8:revision=0101/component=/CMU#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: One or more domains may be reset. It is also possible that some other problem may occur. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The resources associated with the chip will be deconfigured. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: I2C access failure to a specific chip.
